info.title: üñ•Ô∏è FastyBird Smart Panel API üöÄ
info.description:
Welcome to the **FastyBird Smart Panel API Documentation**!

This API is the central interface for integrating with the **FastyBird Smart Panel**, a modern, modular, and open-source platform for managing smart home devices and dashboards ‚Äî all running on **your local hardware**, with no cloud dependency.

---

## üåü What Can This API Do?

The **FastyBird Smart Panel API** provides:

- üéõÔ∏è **Full Access to Smart Devices**  
  Manage devices, channels, and properties ‚Äî read current values or send commands.

- üìä **Real-Time Monitoring & Sync**  
  Receive live updates from sensors, switches, and more through WebSocket connections.

- üîå **Third-Party Integration Support**  
  Easily connect external systems using standard API calls to sync data and trigger actions.

- üß± **Dashboard Customization**  
  Build or modify dashboard layouts, pages, tiles, and data sources dynamically via API.

- üöÄ **Local-First Control**  
  The entire stack is designed to run offline on your own network ‚Äî secure, private, and fast.

---

## üöÄ Getting Started

> üõ†Ô∏è **No cloud required. Everything runs locally.**

### 1. Install the Smart Panel  
Deploy the platform to a supported device like a Raspberry Pi or ReTerminal.

### 2. Connect & Configure Devices  
Add devices via the Admin App or API, either manually or through plugin integrations.

### 3. Interact via REST or WebSocket  
Use the API to read states, send commands, and subscribe to real-time updates.

---

## üîé API Modules Overview

### Devices API  
Manage devices and their structure:  
- Retrieve device/channel/property metadata  
- Send control commands  
- Sync state updates  

### Dashboard API  
Configure your Smart Panel UI:  
- Build pages and tiles  
- Add data sources  
- Organize device widgets  

---

## üìö API Usage Examples

Use this API to:

- üí° Read a temperature sensor value  
- üîò Toggle a light switch  
- üß© Display custom widgets  
- üîÑ Sync external device state  
- üì± Integrate with your own mobile or desktop app  

---

## üîê Authentication

Use token-based access when integrating external apps or third-party devices.  
See the [Authentication Guide](#) for details.

---

## üí¨ Frequently Asked

**Is the API cloud-based?**  
No ‚Äî it runs entirely on your own hardware.

**Do I need to be online?**  
No ‚Äî the API is designed for offline-first use.

**Can I control third-party devices?**  
Yes ‚Äî use plugin-based extensions or the generic third-party interface.

**Does the Smart Panel support real-time updates?**  
Yes ‚Äî WebSocket support is built-in.

---

## ü§ù Need Help?

- üí¨ [Join the FastyBird Community](https://discord.gg/mDU56cxY)  
- üõ†Ô∏è [Explore the Docs](https://smart-panel.fastybird.com/docs)  
- üì® [Report an issue](https://github.com/fastybird/smart-panel/issues)

---

üöÄ **Built with ‚ù§Ô∏è by FastyBird** ‚Äî Local-first, modular smart home integration.

parameters.description: The location for weather updates, specified as a city name or coordinates (latitude, longitude).

parameters.name: location_type
parameters.description: Specifies the method used to determine the location for weather updates.

get.summary: Convert city name to geographical coordinates
get.description: Retrieves latitude and longitude based on a given city name. Useful for mapping and location-based services.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The name of the city for which geographical coordinates are requested.

200.description: Response containing geographical information related to a specified location.

get.summary: Convert coordinates to city name
get.description: Returns the city name based on provided latitude and longitude values. Useful for reverse geocoding applications.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude of the location for reverse geocoding.

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Longitude of the location for reverse geocoding.

200.description: Response containing geographical information related to a specified location.

servers.description: Dummy local URL for third-party device webhook

put.description:
This endpoint is used to send property update commands to a third-party device. The backend calls this webhook with one or more property updates. The third-party device should process the updates and return a status response.

**The actual webhook path must be defined on the third-party device level**, and the backend must be configured accordingly to call the correct endpoint.

requestBody.description: Represents a request to update properties on a third-party device.

204.description: No Content. Indicates that the request was successfully processed and no further response is required.

207.description: Response from the third-party device after processing the update request.

400.description: Bad Request. Indicates that the request was invalid, possibly due to missing or malformed data.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Indicates a server-side error while processing the request.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all available Home Assistant Devices
get.description: Retrieves a list of devices discovered from the connected Home Assistant instance. Each device includes metadata, associated entities, and their current states.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of Home Assistant devices.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Home Assisant discovered device to retrieve.

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific Home Assistant Device
get.description: Fetches details of a specific Home Assistant device by its Home Assistant ID. The response includes associated entities and their current states.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the requested Home Assistant device.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all available Home Assistant States
get.description: Fetches the current state information for all known entities from the connected Home Assistant instance. Each state includes metadata such as attributes and timestamps.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of Home Assistant states.

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: The ID of the Home Assisant entity to retrieve state.

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific Home Assistant State
get.description: Fetches the current state and attributes for a single entity by its Home Assistant entity ID. This includes state value and timestamp details.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the requested Home Assistant state.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all available page cards

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Filter cards by the page resource ID

200.description: The list of cards was successfully retrieved. Each card includes metadata such as its ID, title, and icon.

get.description: Fetches a list of cards associated with a specific page. Cards represent widgets that can be used for displaying data, such as device state, actual clock.

post.summary: Create a new card for a page

Location.description: The URI of the newly created page card resource, which can be used to retrieve, update, or delete the card.

201.description: The card was successfully created. The response contains the details of the newly created card.

post.description: Creates a new card associated with a specific page. Cards represent widgets that can display device state or actual clock.

requestBody.description: The payload schema used for creating a new page card.

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific card for a page

200.description: The details of the card were successfully retrieved. The response contains information such as the card‚Äôs associated tiles, data sources and card details.

get.description: Fetches detailed information about a specific card associated with a page using its unique ID. The response includes metadata such as the card‚Äôs position, ID, associated page, and tiles.

patch.summary: Update an existing card for a page

200.description: Partially updates the attributes of a specific card associated with a page using its unique ID. The update can modify metadata, such as the card‚Äôs title or icon, without requiring the full object.

patch.description: Partially updates the attributes of a specific card associated with a page using its unique ID. The update can modify metadata, such as the card‚Äôs position or title, without requiring the full object.

requestBody.description: The payload schema used for updating a existing page card.

delete.summary: Delete a specific card for a page

204.description: The card was successfully deleted. No content is returned in the response body.

delete.description: Deletes a specific card associated with a page using its unique ID. This action is irreversible and will remove the card and its associated data from the system.

password.description: User's password. Must be at least 6 characters long.

username.description: The username to check for availability.

email.description: The email address to check for availability.

ConfigModuleAudio.title: Audio
ConfigModuleAudio.description: Schema for audio configuration, including speaker and microphone controls.

speaker.description: Indicates whether the speaker is enabled.

speaker_volume.description: The volume level of the speaker, ranging from 0 to 100.

microphone.description: Indicates whether the microphone is enabled.

microphone_volume.description: The volume level of the microphone, ranging from 0 to 100.

ConfigModuleDisplay.title: Display
ConfigModuleDisplay.description: Schema for display configuration, including brightness, dark mode, and screen lock behavior.

dark_mode.description: Enables dark mode for the display.

brightness.description: Sets the brightness level of the display (0-100).

screen_lock_duration.description: Time in seconds before the screen automatically locks.

screen_saver.description: Enables the screen saver when the device is idle. Value is in seconds.

ConfigModuleLanguage.title: Language
ConfigModuleLanguage.description: Schema for language configuration, time zone, and time format on the smart panel.

language.description: Defines the language and region format. Uses standard locale codes (ISO 639-1).

timezone.description: Sets the time format for displaying time on the panel.

time_format.description: Defines the time zone of the smart panel. Uses the IANA time zone format.

ConfigModuleWeather.title: Weather
ConfigModuleWeather.description: Schema for weather configuration, including location, temperature unit, and API integration.

location.description: The location for weather updates, specified as a city name or coordinates (latitude, longitude).

location_type.description: Specifies the method used to determine the location for weather updates.

unit.description: Defines the temperature unit for weather data.

open_weather_api_key.description: API key for OpenWeatherMap. Required only if using OpenWeatherMap as a data source.

ConfigModuleApp.title: Configuration
ConfigModuleApp.description: Schema for the complete configuration settings for the smart panel, including audio, display, language, and weather settings.

audio.description: Audio configuration settings, including speaker and microphone options.

display.description: Display settings, including brightness, dark mode, and screen lock duration.

language.description: Language and localization settings, including time zone and time format.

weather.description: Weather settings, including location, unit preferences, and API integration.

ConfigModuleUpdateAudio.description: Schema for partial update settings for audio configuration, allowing changes to speaker and microphone settings.

ConfigModuleUpdateDisplay.title: Update Display
ConfigModuleUpdateDisplay.description: Schema for partial update settings for display configuration, allowing changes to brightness, dark mode, and screen lock duration.

screen_lock_duration.description: Time in seconds before the screen automatically locks.

screen_saver.description: Enables or disables the screen saver.

ConfigModuleUpdateLanguage.title: Update Language
ConfigModuleUpdateLanguage.description: Schema for partial update settings for language and localization configuration.

language.description: Defines the language and region format.

timezone.description: Defines the time zone using the IANA time zone format.

unit.description: Defines the temperature unit for weather data.

DevicesModuleDevice.title: Device
DevicesModuleDevice.description: Represents the core attributes of a device, including its unique identifier, name, and category. This model forms the foundation for more detailed device representations, such as those including related components (e.g., channels, properties, or controls).

id.description: System-generated unique identifier for the device.

category.description: Type of the device, defining its purpose or category (e.g., thermostat, lighting).

description.description: Optional detailed description of the device.

controls.description: A list of controls associated with the device. Controls represent actions or commands that can be executed on the device.

channels.description: A list of channels associated with the device. Each channel represents a functional unit of the device, such as a sensor, actuator, or logical grouping of properties.

created_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the device was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the device was last updated, if applicable.

DevicesModuleDeviceControl.title: Device Control
DevicesModuleDeviceControl.description: A Device control is an action that can be executed at the device level. It provides operational commands like restarting a device or updating its firmware.

id.description: System-generated unique identifier for the control.

name.description: The name of the control, representing the action it performs.

device.description: The device to which this control belongs.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the control was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the control was last updated, if applicable.

DevicesModuleChannel.title: Channel
DevicesModuleChannel.description: Defines a functional unit of a device, such as a sensor, actuator, or informational component. Channels group related properties and controls for modular device functionality.

id.description: System-generated unique identifier for the channel.

category.description: Type of the channel, indicating its functional category (e.g., temperature, light).

description.description: Optional description of the channel‚Äôs purpose or functionality.

device.description: The parent device to which this channel belongs.

controls.description: A list of controls associated with the device channel. Controls represent actions or commands that can be executed on the channel.

properties.description: A list of properties associated with the device channel. Properties represent the state or attributes of the channel.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the channel was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the channel was last updated, if applicable.

DevicesModuleChannelControl.title: Channel Control
DevicesModuleChannelControl.description: A Channel control defines a specific action or command that can be executed for a channel. Examples include resetting a sensor or changing its operational mode.

id.description: System-generated unique identifier for the channel control.

name.description: The name of the control, representing the action it performs.

channel.description: The channel to which this control belongs.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the control was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the control was last updated, if applicable.

DevicesModuleChannelProperty.title: Channel Property
DevicesModuleChannelProperty.description: A Channel property describes an individual attribute or measurable value associated with a channel. This includes parameters like brightness, temperature, or energy consumption, reflecting the channel‚Äôs current state or configuration.

id.description: System-generated unique identifier for the channel property.

type.description: Specifies the type of channel property.

category.description: Defines the category of the property, representing its functionality or characteristic.

name.description: Optional name of the property for easier identification.

permissions.description: Access level for the property: read-only (ro), read-write (rw), write-only (wo), or event-only (ev).

data_type.description: Data type of the property‚Äôs value, e.g., string, integer, or boolean.

unit.description: Measurement unit associated with the property‚Äôs value, if applicable.

format.description: List of valid values or states for the property, where applicable.

invalid.description: Value to represent an invalid state for the property.

step.description: Step value indicating the smallest increment for the property.

channel.description: Reference to the channel that this property belongs to.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the control was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the control was last updated, if applicable.

DevicesModuleCreateDevice.title: Create Device
DevicesModuleCreateDevice.description: Schema for creating a new device. This includes essential attributes like type, category, and name, along with optional details such as a description.

id.description: Unique identifier for the device. Optional during creation and system-generated if not provided.

category.description: Type of the device, defining its purpose or category (e.g., thermostat, lighting).

description.description: Optional detailed description of the device.

controls.description: A list of controls associated with the device. Controls represent actions or commands that can be executed on the device.

channels.description: A list of channels associated with the device. Each channel represents a functional unit of the device, such as a sensor, actuator, or logical grouping of properties.

DevicesModuleCreateDeviceControl.title: Create Device Control
DevicesModuleCreateDeviceControl.description: Schema for creating a new device control, which represents an action the device can perform.

name.description: The name of the control, representing the action it performs.

id.description: Unique identifier for the channel. Optional during creation and system-generated if not provided.

category.description: Type of the channel, indicating its functional category (e.g., temperature, light).

description.description: Optional description of the channel‚Äôs purpose or functionality.

controls.description: A list of controls associated with the device channel. Controls represent actions or commands that can be executed on the channel.

properties.description: A list of properties associated with the device channel. Properties represent the state or attributes of the channel.

DevicesModuleCreateChannel.title: Create Device Channel
DevicesModuleCreateChannel.description: Schema representing a request to create a new channel for a device.

device.description: The parent device to which this channel belongs.

DevicesModuleCreateChannelControl.title: Create Channel Control
DevicesModuleCreateChannelControl.description: Schema for creating a new control within a channel, representing a specific action or command that can be performed.

unit.description: Measurement unit associated with the property‚Äôs value, if applicable.

invalid.description: Value to represent an invalid state for the property.

step.description: Step value indicating the smallest increment for the property.

DashboardModulePage.description: The base schema for all dashboard pages, including common properties such as id, type, title, and timestamps.
